item.title: VoiceRun nabs $5.5M to build voice agent factory
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: VoiceRun, a startup that creates voice agents, raised $5.5 million in a round led by FlyBridge.

item.title: SkyFi raises $12.7M to turn satellite images into insights
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: The Austin-based marketplace offers imagery from more than 50 space-based imagery providers.

item.title: Converge Bio raises $25M, backed by Bessemer and execs from Meta, OpenAI, Wiz
item.dc:creator: Kate Park
item.description: AI drug discovery startup Converge Bio raised $25 million in a Series A led by Bessemer Venture Partners, with additional backing from executives at Meta, OpenAI, and Wiz.

item.title: Meta-backed Hupo finds growth after pivot to AI sales coaching from mental wellness
item.dc:creator: Kate Park
item.description: Hupo’s approach to sales coaching is less about replacing human judgment and more about helping people in the moments that really matter in banking, insurance, and financial services.

item.title: More than 100 new tech unicorns were minted in 2025 — here they are
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Using data from Crunchbase and PitchBook, TechCrunch tracked down the VC-backed startups that became unicorns so far this year.

item.title: OpenAI buys tiny health records startup Torch for, reportedly, $100M
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: AI health records startup Torch will be using its tech for OpenAI's new ChatGPT Health, according to co-founder Ilya Abyzov.

item.title: These Gen Zers just raised $11.75M to put Africa’s defense back in the hands of Africans
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: African defense company Terra comes out of stealth with an $11.75M round led by Joe Lonsdale's 8VC.

item.title: Nuclear startups are back in vogue with small reactors, and big challenges
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Small modular reactor startups are betting that mass manufacturing will help them bring costs down. But are they underestimating the challenge?

item.title: SpaceX gets FCC approval to launch 7,500 more Starlink satellites
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Beyond simply allowing SpaceX to launch more satellites and expand its high-speed internet coverage, the FCC says its decision also means Starlink satellites can operate across five frequencies to provide direct-to-cell connectivity outside the United States.

item.title: Google moonshot spinout SandboxAQ claims an ex-exec is attempting ‘extortion’
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: A former SandboxAQ executive filed a wrongful termination lawsuit filled with shocking allegations. The company is fighting back, hard.

item.title: CES 2026 was all about ‘physical AI’ and robots, robots, robots
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo, Anthony Ha, Kirsten Korosec, Sean O'Kane
item.description: After years of chatbots and image generators, AI is finally leaving the screen. At CES 2026, that shift became impossible to ignore.  The annual tech showcase in Las Vegas was dominated by “physical AI” and robotics, from Boston Dynamic’s newly redesigned Atlas humanoid robot to AI-powered ice makers (yes, really). The companies in attendance clearly want consumers […]

item.title: CES 2026: Follow live for the best, weirdest, most interesting tech as this robot and AI-heavy event wraps up
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec, Sarah Perez
item.description: CES 2026, the annual consumer tech conference held in Las Vegas, is here. And lucky for you, we have TechCrunch editors and reporters on the ground to cover the news, scout out the interesting, weird, and relevant (and some not so relevant) tech, and of course the people working on it. AI has been at the center of most of the action, whether it's Nvidia and AMD's announcements or Amazon and Google's push for its use in the physical world. Follow our live updates as we share all the reveals and new hardware as it happens.

item.title: Data security startup Cyera hits $9B valuation six months after being valued at $6B
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Cyera raised another $400 million just six months after its last huge round.

item.title: GTMfund has rewritten the distribution playbook for the AI era
item.dc:creator: Maggie Nye, Isabelle Johannessen
item.description: Building software products has never been easier, so why are so many well-funded startups failing to take off no matter how good their product is? In this season finale episode of Build Mode, our guest has an answer: Startups have focused too much on product development and not enough on distribution excellence. Paul Irving is partner and […]

item.title: EverNitro is simplifying the process of crafting silky nitro coffee at CES 2026
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: EverNitro is positioning itself against competitors such as NitroBrew as a long-term more affordable all-in-one solution. “We offer the quality of a commercial tap with the footprint of a coffee maker. While others sell you gas, we give you technology to harvest it for free,” founder and CEO Terry Tan said.

item.title: OpenAI to acquire the team behind executive coaching AI tool Convogo
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: OpenAI is acquiring the team behind executive coaching AI tool Convogo in an all-stock deal, adding to the firm's M&A spree.

item.title: The most bizarre tech announced so far at CES 2026
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: From an AI panda pet to an anime girl hologram for your desk, here are the wildest products at CES 2026.

item.title: Go-to-market strategies for an AI era
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen
item.description: In the season finale of Build Mode, Isabelle Johannessen sits down with Paul Irving, partner and COO of GTMfund, to discuss go-to-market strategies for the AI era. Paul shares specific, actionable advice on how early-stage startups can win even when facing well-funded competitors who iterate at lightning speed. He also explains why distribution has become the final remaining moat when technical advantages disappear in months […]

item.title: It’s time to throw away the old go-to-market playbook
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen
item.description: In the season finale of Build Mode, Isabelle Johannessen sits down with Paul Irving, partner and COO of GTMfund, to discuss go-to-market strategies for the AI era. Irving shares specific, actionable advice on how early-stage startups can win even when facing well-funded competitors who iterate at lightning speed. He also explains why distribution has become the final remaining moat when technical advantages disappear in months […]

item.title: Why this VC thinks 2026 will be ‘the year of the consumer’
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: AI adoption in enterprise is stalling as companies don't know where to start. Vanessa Larco of Premise VC thinks 2026 will be the year of the consumer.
